intro: Garnotia patens, commonly known as the spreading garnotia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals. Garnotia patens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas.
